docs.title: Welcome to LLM Agents Search
docs.text: Explore our curated collection of 9+ LLM agents and tools across 4 categories.

docs.title: Featured Agents
docs.text: Discover the most popular and innovative LLM agents, frameworks, and tools.

docs.title: AI Tools
docs.text: **[AutoGPT](AI Tools/AutoGPT)**  AI Tools  An experimental open-source attempt to make GPT-4 fully autonomous  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/Significant-Gravitas/AutoGPT){ .md-button }     **[LangChain](AI Tools/LangChain)**  AI Tools  Building applications with LLMs through composability  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/langchain-ai/langchain){ .md-button }     **[LlamaIndex](AI Tools/LlamaIndex)**  AI Tools  Data framework for LLM applications  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index){ .md-button }

docs.title: Agent Frameworks
docs.text: **[AutoGen](Agent Frameworks/AutoGen)**  Agent Frameworks  Enabling the development of LLM applications using multiple agents  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/microsoft/autogen){ .md-button }     **[CrewAI](Agent Frameworks/CrewAI)**  Agent Frameworks  Framework for orchestrating role-playing autonomous AI agents  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/joaomdmoura/crewAI){ .md-button }

docs.title: Chatbots
docs.text: **[ChatGPT-Clone](Chatbots/ChatGPT-Clone)**  Chatbots  A conversational AI system  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/openai/chatgpt){ .md-button }     **[Transformer Chatbot](Chatbots/Transformer-Chatbot)**  Chatbots  A PyTorch implementation of a sequence-to-sequence model for chatbot  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/bentrevett/pytorch-seq2seq){ .md-button }

docs.title: Data Analysis
docs.text: **[Code Interpreter](Data Analysis/Code-Interpreter)**  Data Analysis  Code interpreter API for LLMs  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/shroominic/codeinterpreter-api){ .md-button }     **[Pandas-AI](Data Analysis/Pandas-AI)**  Data Analysis  Pandas AI is a Python library that integrates LLMs into pandas  [:material-github: View Repository](https://github.com/gventuri/pandas-ai){ .md-button }

docs.title: Documentation Structure
docs.text:
The documentation is organized into the following categories:

  • AI Tools - 3 agents
  • Agent Frameworks - 2 agents
  • Chatbots - 2 agents
  • Data Analysis - 2 agents

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Browse the agent cards above or use the search to find specific agents. Each agent page includes: - Detailed description - GitHub repository link - Installation instructions - Usage examples - Documentation

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Found an interesting LLM agent or tool? Consider contributing to our collection!

docs.title: Documentation Naming Conventions
docs.text: This document outlines the naming conventions and folder structure standards for the LLM Agents Search documentation.

docs.title: Folder Structure
docs.text:
The documentation is organized into category-based subfolders within the docs/ directory:

docs/
├── index.md                           # Homepage
├── NAMING_CONVENTIONS.md             # This file
├── starter_ai_agents/                # Basic AI agent implementations
├── advanced_ai_agents/               # Complex AI agent patterns
├── multi_agent_teams/                # Multi-agent system documentation
├── voice_ai_agents/                  # Voice-enabled AI agents
├── mcp_ai_agents/                    # Model Context Protocol agents
├── rag_agents/                       # Retrieval-Augmented Generation agents
├── memory_tutorials/                 # Memory and context management
└── chat_with_x/                      # Chat integration tutorials

docs.title: Category Folders
docs.text:
• Format: lowercase_with_underscores
  • Examples: starter_ai_agents, multi_agent_teams
  • Purpose: Group related documentation by topic or agent type

docs.title: Documentation Files
docs.text:
• Format: lowercase_with_underscores.md
  • Examples: agent_setup.md, configuration_guide.md
  • Purpose: Individual documentation pages within categories

docs.title: Index Files
docs.text: Each category folder should contain an index.md file that serves as the landing page for that section.

docs.title: Agent Page Naming
docs.text:
When creating documentation for individual agents:

  1. Use descriptive names: web_search_agent.md instead of agent1.md
  2. Follow lowercase convention: Always use lowercase with underscores
  3. Include the agent type: Make it clear what category the agent belongs to
  4. Keep it concise: Prefer shorter, clearer names

docs.title: MkDocs Navigation
docs.text: The mkdocs.yml file uses these naming conventions to structure the navigation menu. Ensure file names match the nav configuration.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Be consistent: Always follow the established patterns
  2. Use clear, descriptive names: Make content self-explanatory
  3. Avoid special characters: Stick to alphanumeric and underscores
  4. Keep names short: Long names are harder to read and link to
  5. Group logically: Place files in the most appropriate category folder

docs.title: Adding New Content
docs.text:
When adding new documentation:

  1. Choose the appropriate category folder
  2. Create a new .md file following the naming conventions
  3. Add the file to the mkdocs.yml navigation
  4. Update the category's index.md if needed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Good names: - web_search_agent.md - memory_management.md - voice_integration.md

Avoid: - Agent1.md (use lowercase) - my-new-file.md (use underscores, not hyphens) - VeryLongDescriptiveFileNameThatIsHardToRead.md (too long)

docs.title: Advanced AI Agents
docs.text: Documentation for sophisticated AI agents with complex capabilities and configurations.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section contains advanced AI agents that require:

  • Deep understanding of AI concepts
  • Complex configuration and setup
  • Integration with multiple services
  • Advanced customization options

docs.title: Coming Soon
docs.text: Individual agent documentation will be added here as the project grows.

docs.title: Chat With X
docs.text: Documentation for AI agents that enable chatting with various data sources and systems.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section contains agents that allow conversations with:

  • Document collections
  • Databases
  • APIs and services
  • Custom data sources

docs.title: Coming Soon
docs.text: Chat agent documentation will be added here as the project grows.

docs.title: MCP AI Agents
docs.text: Documentation for AI agents using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section covers MCP-compatible agents that provide:

  • Standardized context management
  • Protocol-compliant communication
  • Enhanced context awareness
  • MCP server integration

docs.title: Coming Soon
docs.text: MCP AI agent documentation will be added here as the project grows.

docs.title: Memory Tutorials
docs.text: Documentation and tutorials for AI agents with advanced memory capabilities.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section covers agents with sophisticated memory features:

  • Long-term memory storage
  • Context retention strategies
  • Memory optimization techniques
  • Stateful interactions

docs.title: Multi-Agent Teams
docs.text: Documentation for AI agent teams that work together to accomplish complex tasks.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section covers systems where multiple AI agents collaborate, including:

  • Agent orchestration patterns

docs.title: RAG Agents
docs.text: Documentation for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) AI agents.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section contains RAG agents featuring:

docs.title: Starter AI Agents
docs.text: Documentation for beginner-friendly AI agents that are easy to set up and use.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section contains AI agents suitable for users who are new to AI agent technology. These agents typically have:

  • Simple configuration
  • Clear documentation
  • Minimal dependencies
  • Quick start guides

docs.text: Documentation for AI agents that process and generate voice/audio content.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This section contains voice-enabled AI agents featuring:

  • Speech recognition capabilities

  • Audio processing
  • Real-time voice interaction
